entries.source: You can easily navigate through the settings by clicking the icons in the header above.
entries.translated: You can easily navigate through the settings by clicking the icons in the header above.

entries.source: Some settings below require reopening tabs or reloading the plugin to take effect.
entries.translated: Some settings below require reopening tabs or reloading the plugin to take effect.

entries.source: By allowing PDF++ to modify PDF files directly, you can:
entries.translated: By allowing PDF++ to modify PDF files directly, you can:

entries.source: Add, edit and delete highlights and links in PDF files.
entries.translated: Add, edit and delete highlights and links in PDF files.

entries.source: Add, insert, delete or extract PDF pages and auto-update links.
entries.translated: Add, insert, delete or extract PDF pages and auto-update links.

entries.source: Add, rename, move and delete outline items.
entries.translated: Add, rename, move and delete outline items.

entries.source: Enable PDF editing
entries.translated: Enable PDF editing

entries.source: The author assumes no responsibility for any data corruption. Please make sure you have a backup of your files.
entries.translated: The author assumes no responsibility for any data corruption. Please make sure you have a backup of your files.

entries.source: Annotate PDF files with highlights just by linking to text selection. You can easily copy links to selections using color palette in the toolbar. See the "Color palette" section for the details.
entries.translated: Annotate PDF files with highlights just by linking to text selection. You can easily copy links to selections using color palette in the toolbar. See the "Color palette" section for the details.

entries.source: Highlight backlinks in PDF viewer
entries.translated: Highlight backlinks in PDF viewer

entries.source: In the PDF viewer, any referenced text will be highlighted for easy identification.
entries.translated: In the PDF viewer, any referenced text will be highlighted for easy identification.

entries.translated: Try turning off the following options if you experience performance issues.

entries.source: If some notes are opened in the ignored splits, PDF++ will still open the backlink in the way specified in the previous setting. For example, you might want to ignore the left sidebar if you are pinning a certain note (e.g. daily note) in it.

entries.translated: Don't move focus to markdown view after opening a backlink

entries.translated: Colors

entries.source: Highlight colors
entries.translated: Highlight colors

entries.source: You can ues the color palette in PDF toolbars to easily copy links with "&color=..." appended automatically. See the "Color palette" section for the details.
entries.translated: You can ues the color palette in PDF toolbars to easily copy links with "&color=..." appended automatically. See the "Color palette" section for the details.

entries.source: You can also opt not to use this plugin-dependent notation and apply a single color (the "default highlight color" setting) to all highlights.
entries.translated: You can also opt not to use this plugin-dependent notation and apply a single color (the "default highlight color" setting) to all highlights.

entries.source: Highlight a backlink only if a color is specified
entries.translated: Highlight a backlink only if a color is specified

entries.source: By default, all backlinks are highlighted. If this option is enabled, a backlink will be highlighted only when a color is specified in the link text.
entries.translated: By default, all backlinks are highlighted. If this option is enabled, a backlink will be highlighted only when a color is specified in the link text.

entries.translated: Default highlight color

entries.source: If no color is specified in link text, this color will be used.
entries.translated: If no color is specified in link text, this color will be used.

entries.translated: Bounding rectangles will be shown for annotations with backlinks.

entries.translated: Backlink indicator icons

entries.translated: Show icons for text selections, annotations, offsets and rectangular selections with backlinks.

entries.source: By default, rectangular selection embeds are re-rendered every time you open the markdown file, which can slow down the loading time. Turn on this option to replace them with static images and improve the performance.
entries.translated: By default, rectangular selection embeds are re-rendered every time you open the markdown file, which can slow down the loading time. Turn on this option to replace them with static images and improve the performance.

entries.source: Follow "adapt to theme" setting
entries.translated: Follow "adapt to theme" setting

entries.source: If enabled, rectangular selection embeds will be inverted in color when the "Adapt to theme" setting is enabled in the PDF toolbar. This will help you reduce eye strain in dark mode.
entries.translated: If enabled, rectangular selection embeds will be inverted in color when the "Adapt to theme" setting is enabled in the PDF toolbar. This will help you reduce eye strain in dark mode.

entries.source: Rendering resolution
entries.translated: Rendering resolution

entries.source: The higher the value, the better the rendering quality, but the longer time it takes to render. The default value is 100.
entries.translated: The higher the value, the better the rendering quality, but the longer time it takes to render. The default value is 100.

entries.source: Include the selected color's name when copying a link to a rectangular selection
entries.translated: Include the selected color's name when copying a link to a rectangular selection

entries.source: When enabled, the name of the color selected in the color palette will be included in the link text. As a result, the rectangular selection will be highlighted with the specified color in the PDF viewer.
entries.translated: When enabled, the name of the color selected in the color palette will be included in the link text. As a result, the rectangular selection will be highlighted with the specified color in the PDF viewer.

entries.source: Zoom to fit rectangular selection when opening link
entries.translated: Zoom to fit rectangular selection when opening link

entries.translated: Use PDF++ callouts

entries.translated: (Not supported on smartphones) When enabled, the dropdown menus (⌄) in the PDF toolbar will be opened by hovering over the icon, and you don't need to click it.

entries.translated: Show zoom level box

entries.translated: A input box will be added to the PDF toolbar, which indicated the current zoom level and allows you to set the zoom level by typing a number.

entries.translated: Color palette

entries.translated: Clicking a color while selecting a range of text will copy a link to the selection with "&color=..." appended.

entries.translated: Show context menu on tablet devices as well

entries.source: By default, Obsidian does not show the context menu after text selection on mobile devices, including tablets (iPad, etc.). If you want to show the context menu on tablets, turn this option on. Even if this option is turned off, you copy select the OS-native "Copy" option to run the "Copy link to selection or annotation" command.
entries.translated: By default, Obsidian does not show the context menu after text selection on mobile devices, including tablets (iPad, etc.). If you want to show the context menu on tablets, turn this option on. Even if this option is turned off, you copy select the OS-native "Copy" option to run the "Copy link to selection or annotation" command.

entries.source: Update color palette from context menu
entries.translated: Update color palette from context menu

entries.source: In the context menu, the items (color, copy format and display text format) set in the color palette are selected by default. If this option is enabled, selecting a menu item will also update the color palette state and hence the default-selected items in the context menu as well. Even if this option is enabled, you can prevent the color palette from being updated by holding down the Ctrl key while selecting the menu item.
entries.translated: In the context menu, the items (color, copy format and display text format) set in the color palette are selected by default. If this option is enabled, selecting a menu item will also update the color palette state and hence the default-selected items in the context menu as well. Even if this option is enabled, you can prevent the color palette from being updated by holding down the Ctrl key while selecting the menu item.

entries.translated: Action triggered by selecting "Copy" option on mobile devices

entries.translated: Obsidian default (copy as quote)

entries.source: Run PDF++'s copy command
entries.translated: Run PDF++'s copy command

entries.source: Set up hotkeys for copying links
entries.translated: Set up hotkeys for copying links

entries.source: PDF++ offers two commands for quickly copying links via hotkeys.
entries.translated: PDF++ offers two commands for quickly copying links via hotkeys.

entries.source: After running this command, you can add the copied link to the PDF file itself: select a range of text, right-click, and then click "Paste copied link to selection".
entries.translated: After running this command, you can add the copied link to the PDF file itself: select a range of text, right-click, and then click "Paste copied link to selection".

entries.source: Open hotkeys settings
entries.translated: Open hotkeys settings

entries.source: Further workflow enhancements
entries.translated: Further workflow enhancements

entries.source: PDF++ also offers the following commands for reducing mouse clicks on the PDF toolbar by assigning hotkeys to them.
entries.translated: PDF++ also offers the following commands for reducing mouse clicks on the PDF toolbar by assigning hotkeys to them.

entries.source: And more...
entries.translated: And more...

entries.source: Show outline: when the active file is not PDF, run the core Outline plugin's "Show outline" command
entries.translated: Show outline: when the active file is not PDF, run the core Outline plugin's "Show outline" command

entries.source: By turning this on, you can use the same hotkey to show the outline of a markdown file and a PDF file without key conflict.
entries.translated: By turning this on, you can use the same hotkey to show the outline of a markdown file and a PDF file without key conflict.

entries.source: Show outline / show thumbnail: close the sidebar if it is already open
entries.translated: Show outline / show thumbnail: close the sidebar if it is already open

entries.source: Enabling this will allow you to use the same hotkey to close the sidebar if it is already open.
entries.translated: Enabling this will allow you to use the same hotkey to close the sidebar if it is already open.

entries.source: Zoom in / zoom out: when the active file is not PDF, run the built-in "Zoom in" / "Zoom out" command
entries.translated: Zoom in / zoom out: when the active file is not PDF, run the built-in "Zoom in" / "Zoom out" command

entries.source: By turning this on, you can use the same hotkey to zoom in/out a PDF viewer or any other type of view without key conflict.
entries.translated: By turning this on, you can use the same hotkey to zoom in/out a PDF viewer or any other type of view without key conflict.

entries.source: Zoom in / zoom out: when the active file is not PDF, run Font Size Adjuster's "Increment font size" / "Decrement font size" command
entries.translated: Zoom in / zoom out: when the active file is not PDF, run Font Size Adjuster's "Increment font size" / "Decrement font size" command

entries.source: The template format that will be used when copying a link to a selection or an annotation in PDF viewer.
entries.translated: The template format that will be used when copying a link to a selection or an annotation in PDF viewer.

entries.translated: Available variables are:

entries.translated: Additionally, you have access to the following variables when the PDF file has a corresponding markdown file specified via the "PDF" property(see the "Property to associate a markdown file to a PDF file" setting below):

entries.source: Speed up the process of copying & pasting PDF links to your notes with some automation. Note that you can't activate both of auto-focus and auto-paste at the same time.
entries.translated: Speed up the process of copying & pasting PDF links to your notes with some automation. Note that you can't activate both of auto-focus and auto-paste at the same time.

entries.source: Auto-copy
entries.translated: Auto-copy

entries.source: If enabled, the "Copy link to selection or annotation" command will be triggered automatically every time you select a range of text in a PDF viewer, meaning you don't even have to press a hotkey to copy a link.
entries.translated: If enabled, the "Copy link to selection or annotation" command will be triggered automatically every time you select a range of text in a PDF viewer, meaning you don't even have to press a hotkey to copy a link.

entries.source: Enable
entries.translated: Enable

entries.translated: Last pasted .md if any, otherwise last active .md

entries.source: Last pasted .md if any, otherwise last active & open .md
entries.translated: Last pasted .md if any, otherwise last active & open .md

entries.source: Last active & open .md if any, otherwise last pasted .md
entries.translated: Last active & open .md if any, otherwise last pasted .md

entries.source: Auto-paste
entries.translated: Auto-paste

entries.source: If enabled, the copied link to PDF text selection or annotation will be automatically pasted into a markdown file right after copying.
entries.translated: If enabled, the copied link to PDF text selection or annotation will be automatically pasted into a markdown file right after copying.

entries.source: You can also toggle auto-paste via an icon in the left ribbon menu if the next setting is enabled.
entries.translated: You can also toggle auto-paste via an icon in the left ribbon menu if the next setting is enabled.

entries.source: Show an icon to toggle auto-paste in the left ribbon menu
entries.translated: Show an icon to toggle auto-paste in the left ribbon menu

entries.source: You can also toggle auto-paste via a command. Reload the plugin after changing this setting to take effect.
entries.translated: You can also toggle auto-paste via a command. Reload the plugin after changing this setting to take effect.

entries.source: Target markdown file to paste links to
entries.translated: Target markdown file to paste links to

entries.source: Focus editor after auto-pasting
entries.translated: Focus editor after auto-pasting

entries.source: If enabled, auto-paste will focus on the editor after pasting.
entries.translated: If enabled, auto-paste will focus on the editor after pasting.

entries.source: Clear text selection after auto-pasting
entries.translated: Clear text selection after auto-pasting

entries.source: If enabled, the text selection in the PDF viewer will be automatically cleared after performing auto-pasting.
entries.translated: If enabled, the text selection in the PDF viewer will be automatically cleared after performing auto-pasting.

entries.source: Respect current cursor position
entries.translated: Respect current cursor position

entries.source: When enabled, triggering auto-pasting will paste the copied text at the current cursor position if the target note is already opened. If disabled, the text will be always appended to the end of the note.
entries.translated: When enabled, triggering auto-pasting will paste the copied text at the current cursor position if the target note is already opened. If disabled, the text will be always appended to the end of the note.

entries.source: Blank line above the appended content
entries.translated: Blank line above the appended content

entries.source: Because you disabled the option above, auto-pasted content will be added at the end of your note. Enable this option to make sure that you have a blank line between the existing content and the newly added content.
entries.translated: Because you disabled the option above, auto-pasted content will be added at the end of your note. Enable this option to make sure that you have a blank line between the existing content and the newly added content.

entries.source: General
entries.translated: General

entries.source: General settings that apply to both auto-focus and auto-paste.
entries.translated: General settings that apply to both auto-focus and auto-paste.

entries.source: Open target markdown file if not opened
entries.translated: Open target markdown file if not opened

entries.source: How to open target markdown file when not opened
entries.translated: How to open target markdown file when not opened

entries.source: Hover Editor
entries.translated: Hover Editor

entries.source: Close Hover Editor when it loses focus
entries.translated: Close Hover Editor when it loses focus

entries.source: This option will not affect the behavior of Hover Editor outside of PDF++.
entries.translated: This option will not affect the behavior of Hover Editor outside of PDF++.

entries.source: Auto-hide sidebar when it loses focus after auto-pasting
entries.translated: Auto-hide sidebar when it loses focus after auto-pasting

entries.source: After auto-pasting into a markdown file opened in the left or right sidebar, the sidebar will be automatically collapsed once it loses focus.
entries.translated: After auto-pasting into a markdown file opened in the left or right sidebar, the sidebar will be automatically collapsed once it loses focus.

entries.source: Always open in editing view
entries.translated: Always open in editing view

entries.source: This option can be useful especially when you set the previous option to "Hover Editor".
entries.translated: This option can be useful especially when you set the previous option to "Hover Editor".

entries.source: Execute command when target file cannot be determined
entries.translated: Execute command when target file cannot be determined

entries.source: When PDF++ cannot determine which markdown file to focus on or paste to, it will execute the command specified in the next option to let you pick a target file.
entries.translated: When PDF++ cannot determine which markdown file to focus on or paste to, it will execute the command specified in the next option to let you pick a target file.

entries.source: Command to execute
entries.translated: Command to execute

entries.source: Here's some examples of useful commands:
entries.translated: Here's some examples of useful commands:

entries.translated: 快速切换: 打开快速切换

entries.source: [Auto-paste] Maximum time to wait for the command to open the target file (sec)
entries.translated: [Auto-paste] Maximum time to wait for the command to open the target file (sec)

entries.source: The link will be auto-pasted into the first markdown file that you open within this time frame after the command is executed. If you don't open any markdown file during this time, the auto-paste will not occur. This option is not related to auto-focus.
entries.translated: The link will be auto-pasted into the first markdown file that you open within this time frame after the command is executed. If you don't open any markdown file during this time, the auto-paste will not occur. This option is not related to auto-focus.

entries.source: The "PDF++: Create new note for auto-focus or auto-paste" command
entries.translated: The "PDF++: Create new note for auto-focus or auto-paste" command

entries.source: Creates a new note and opens it in a new pane specified in the "How to open target markdown file when not opened" option.
entries.translated: Creates a new note and opens it in a new pane specified in the "How to open target markdown file when not opened" option.

entries.translated: New note title format

entries.translated: See

entries.translated: for the details about these variables.

entries.translated: Template file path

entries.translated: Example:

entries.source: Drag & drop annotation popup to insert a link to the annotation
entries.translated: Drag & drop annotation popup to insert a link to the annotation

entries.source: Note that turning on this option disables text selection in the annotation popup (e.g. modified date, author, etc).
entries.translated: Note that turning on this option disables text selection in the annotation popup (e.g. modified date, author, etc).

entries.source: If an annotation has a comment, show the annotation popup on hover
entries.translated: If an annotation has a comment, show the annotation popup on hover

entries.source: This is the same behavior as the PDF viewers of some web browsers (e.g. Chrome/Firefox). You may have to reopen the PDF file after changing this option.
entries.translated: This is the same behavior as the PDF viewers of some web browsers (e.g. Chrome/Firefox). You may have to reopen the PDF file after changing this option.

entries.source: Render markdown in annotation popups when the annotation has text contents
entries.translated: Render markdown in annotation popups when the annotation has text contents

entries.source: Make it easier to work with internal links embedded in PDF files.
entries.translated: Make it easier to work with internal links embedded in PDF files.

entries.source: You may want to turn this off to avoid conflicts with hover+ctrl.Reopen tabs or reload the app after changing this option.
entries.translated: You may want to turn this off to avoid conflicts with hover+ctrl.Reopen tabs or reload the app after changing this option.

entries.source: Show a popover preview of PDF internal links by hover(+ctrl)
entries.translated: Show a popover preview of PDF internal links by hover(+ctrl)

entries.source: Currently required. You can toggle this on and off in the core Page Preview plugin settings > PDF++: internal links in PDF (except for citations).
entries.translated: Currently required. You can toggle this on and off in the core Page Preview plugin settings > PDF++: internal links in PDF (except for citations).

entries.source: Enable history navigation for PDF internal links
entries.translated: Enable history navigation for PDF internal links

entries.source: When enabled, clicking the "navigate back" (left arrow) button will take you back to the page you were originally viewing before clicking on an internal link in the PDF file.
entries.translated: When enabled, clicking the "navigate back" (left arrow) button will take you back to the page you were originally viewing before clicking on an internal link in the PDF file.

entries.source: Copy PDF link as Obsidian link
entries.translated: Copy PDF link as Obsidian link

entries.source: (Requires custom context menu enabled) In the PDF viewer, right-click a PDF-embedded link and then click "Copy PDF link as Obsidian link". It will copy the PDF link as an Obsidian link that you can paste into markdown files. Clicking the pasted link will take you to the same destination as the original PDF link.
entries.translated: (Requires custom context menu enabled) In the PDF viewer, right-click a PDF-embedded link and then click "Copy PDF link as Obsidian link". It will copy the PDF link as an Obsidian link that you can paste into markdown files. Clicking the pasted link will take you to the same destination as the original PDF link.

entries.source: "Copy link to current page view" command
entries.translated: "Copy link to current page view" command

entries.source: Running this command while viewing a PDF file will copy a link, clicking which will open the PDF file at the current scroll position and zoom level.
entries.translated: Running this command while viewing a PDF file will copy a link, clicking which will open the PDF file at the current scroll position and zoom level.

entries.source: Paste copied link to a text selection in a PDF file
entries.translated: Paste copied link to a text selection in a PDF file

entries.source: (Requires custom context menu & PDF editing enabled) After copying a link by the above actions, you can "paste" it to a selection in PDF to create a PDF internal link. To do this, right-click the selection and click "Paste copied link to selection".
entries.translated: (Requires custom context menu & PDF editing enabled) After copying a link by the above actions, you can "paste" it to a selection in PDF to create a PDF internal link. To do this, right-click the selection and click "Paste copied link to selection".

entries.source: The current implementation is based on some pretty primitive hand-crafted rules, and there is a lot of room for improvement. Code contribution is much appreciated!
entries.translated: The current implementation is based on some pretty primitive hand-crafted rules, and there is a lot of room for improvement. Code contribution is much appreciated!

entries.source: Hover(+ctrl) on a citation link to show...
entries.translated: Hover(+ctrl) on a citation link to show...

entries.source: Same as other internal links
entries.translated: Same as other internal links

entries.source: PDF++'s custom bibliography popover
entries.translated: PDF++'s custom bibliography popover

entries.source: Google Scholar popover
entries.translated: Google Scholar popover

entries.source: Currently not required. You can toggle this on and off in the core Page Preview plugin settings > PDF++: citation links in PDF.
entries.translated: Currently not required. You can toggle this on and off in the core Page Preview plugin settings > PDF++: citation links in PDF.

entries.source: AnyStyle path
entries.translated: AnyStyle path

entries.source: Citation ID patterns
entries.translated: Citation ID patterns

entries.source: You don't need to care about this option in most use cases - just leave it to the default value. For advanced users: most internal links in PDF files use so-called destination names to specify the target location. This option allows you to specify the regular expressions (separated by line breaks) that determine whether a given internal link is a citation link based on the dsetination name.
entries.translated: You don't need to care about this option in most use cases - just leave it to the default value. For advanced users: most internal links in PDF files use so-called destination names to specify the target location. This option allows you to specify the regular expressions (separated by line breaks) that determine whether a given internal link is a citation link based on the dsetination name.

entries.translated: Enable bibliography extraction in PDF embeds

entries.translated: Enable bibliography extraction in Canvas

entries.translated: Enable bibliography extraction in hover popover previews

entries.translated: Make it easier to work with external links embedded in PDF files.

entries.translated: Show a popover preview of external links by hover(+ctrl)

entries.source: Currently required. You can toggle this on and off in the core Page Preview plugin settings > PDF++: external links in PDF.
entries.translated: Currently required. You can toggle this on and off in the core Page Preview plugin settings > PDF++: external links in PDF.

entries.source: General settings for the PDF sidebar. The options specific to the outline and thumbnails are located in the corresponding sections below.
entries.translated: General settings for the PDF sidebar. The options specific to the outline and thumbnails are located in the corresponding sections below.

entries.translated: Click on PDF content to hide sidebar

entries.translated: Requires reopening the tabs after changing this option.

entries.translated: Default sidebar view

entries.translated: Reopen PDFs after changing this option.

entries.translated: Thumbnails

entries.source: Outline
entries.translated: Outline

entries.source: Power up the outline view of the built-in PDF viewer: add, rename, or delete items via the right-click menu and the "Add to outline" command, drag & drop items to insert a section link, and more.
entries.translated: Power up the outline view of the built-in PDF viewer: add, rename, or delete items via the right-click menu and the "Add to outline" command, drag & drop items to insert a section link, and more.

entries.source: Show popover preview by hover(+ctrl)
entries.translated: Show popover preview by hover(+ctrl)

entries.source: Reopen tabs or reload the app after changing this option.
entries.translated: Reopen tabs or reload the app after changing this option.

entries.source: Currently required. You can toggle this on and off in the core Page Preview plugin settings > PDF++: outlines (bookmarks).
entries.translated: Currently required. You can toggle this on and off in the core Page Preview plugin settings > PDF++: outlines (bookmarks).

entries.source: Record to history when clicking an outline item
entries.translated: Record to history when clicking an outline item

entries.source: Replace the built-in context menu in the outline with a custom one
entries.translated: Replace the built-in context menu in the outline with a custom one

entries.source: This enables you to insert a section link with a custom format by right-clicking an item in the outline. Moreover, you will be able to add, rename, or delete outline items if PDF modification is enabled.
entries.translated: This enables you to insert a section link with a custom format by right-clicking an item in the outline. Moreover, you will be able to add, rename, or delete outline items if PDF modification is enabled.

entries.source: Drag & drop outline item to insert link to section
entries.translated: Drag & drop outline item to insert link to section

entries.source: Grab an item in the outline and drop it to a markdown file to insert a section link. Changing this option requires reopening the tabs or reloading the app.
entries.translated: Grab an item in the outline and drop it to a markdown file to insert a section link. Changing this option requires reopening the tabs or reloading the app.

entries.source: Copy outline as markdown
entries.translated: Copy outline as markdown

entries.source: You can copy PDF outline as a markdown list or headings using the commands "Copy outline as markdown list" and "Copy outline as markdown headings".
entries.translated: You can copy PDF outline as a markdown list or headings using the commands "Copy outline as markdown list" and "Copy outline as markdown headings".

entries.source: List: display text format
entries.translated: List: display text format

entries.source: List: copy format
entries.translated: List: copy format

entries.source: You don't need to include leading hyphens in the template.
entries.translated: You don't need to include leading hyphens in the template.

entries.source: Headings: display text format
entries.translated: Headings: display text format

entries.source: Headings: copy format
entries.translated: Headings: copy format

entries.source: You don't need to include leading hashes in the template.
entries.translated: You don't need to include leading hashes in the template.

entries.source: Headings: minimum level
entries.translated: Headings: minimum level

entries.source: The copied headings will start at this level.
entries.translated: The copied headings will start at this level.

entries.source: You may want to turn this off to avoid conflicts with hover+ctrlReopen tabs or reload the app after changing this option.
entries.translated: You may want to turn this off to avoid conflicts with hover+ctrlReopen tabs or reload the app after changing this option.

entries.source: Currently required. You can toggle this on and off in the core Page Preview plugin settings > PDF++: thumbnails.
entries.translated: Currently required. You can toggle this on and off in the core Page Preview plugin settings > PDF++: thumbnails.

entries.source: Record to history when clicking a thumbnail
entries.translated: Record to history when clicking a thumbnail

entries.source: Replace the built-in context menu in thumbnails with a custom one
entries.translated: Replace the built-in context menu in thumbnails with a custom one

entries.source: This enables you to copy a page link with a custom display text format specified in the PDF toolbar by right-clicking a thumbnail. Moreover, you will be able to insert, delete, extract pages if PDF modification is enabled.
entries.translated: This enables you to copy a page link with a custom display text format specified in the PDF toolbar by right-clicking a thumbnail. Moreover, you will be able to insert, delete, extract pages if PDF modification is enabled.

entries.source: Drag & drop PDF thumbnail to insert link to page
entries.translated: Drag & drop PDF thumbnail to insert link to page

entries.source: Grab a thumbnail image and drop it to a markdown file to insert a page link. Changing this option requires reopening the tabs or reloading the app.
entries.translated: Grab a thumbnail image and drop it to a markdown file to insert a page link. Changing this option requires reopening the tabs or reloading the app.

entries.source: Note: When disabled, drag-and-drop will cause the thumbnail image to be paste as a data url, which is seemingly Obsidian's bug.
entries.translated: Note: When disabled, drag-and-drop will cause the thumbnail image to be paste as a data url, which is seemingly Obsidian's bug.

entries.source: Always warn when deleting a page
entries.translated: Always warn when deleting a page

entries.source: Warn when deleting a page with backlinks
entries.translated: Warn when deleting a page with backlinks

entries.source: Remove the extracted pages from the original PDF by default
entries.translated: Remove the extracted pages from the original PDF by default

entries.source: Ask whether to remove the extracted pages from the original PDF before extracting
entries.translated: Ask whether to remove the extracted pages from the original PDF before extracting

entries.source: Open extracted PDF file
entries.translated: Open extracted PDF file

entries.source: If enabled, the newly created PDF file will be opened after running the commands "Extract this page to a new file" or "Divide this PDF into two files at this page".
entries.translated: If enabled, the newly created PDF file will be opened after running the commands "Extract this page to a new file" or "Divide this PDF into two files at this page".

entries.source: How to open
entries.translated: How to open

entries.source: Page labels
entries.translated: Page labels

entries.source: You can also modify page labels directly using the command "Edit page labels".
entries.translated: You can also modify page labels directly using the command "Edit page labels".

entries.source: Insert: default page label processing
entries.translated: Insert: default page label processing

entries.source: Applies to the commands "Insert page before/after this page".
entries.translated: Applies to the commands "Insert page before/after this page".

entries.source: Keep labels unchanged
entries.translated: Keep labels unchanged

entries.source: Update
entries.translated: Update

entries.source: Insert: ask whether to update
entries.translated: Insert: ask whether to update

entries.source: Delete: default page label processing
entries.translated: Delete: default page label processing

entries.source: Applies to the command "Delete this page".
entries.translated: Applies to the command "Delete this page".

entries.source: Delete: ask whether to update
entries.translated: Delete: ask whether to update

entries.source: Extract: default page label processing
entries.translated: Extract: default page label processing

entries.translated: Applies to the commands "Extract this page to a new file" and "Divide this PDF into two files at this page".

entries.source: Extract: ask whether to update
entries.translated: Extract: ask whether to update

entries.source: Always record to history when opening PDF links
entries.translated: Always record to history when opening PDF links

entries.source: By default, the history is recorded only when you open a link to a different PDF file. If enabled, the history will be recorded even when you open a link to the same PDF file as the current one, and you will be able to go back and forth the history by clicking the left/right arrow buttons even within a single PDF file.
entries.translated: By default, the history is recorded only when you open a link to a different PDF file. If enabled, the history will be recorded even when you open a link to the same PDF file as the current one, and you will be able to go back and forth the history by clicking the left/right arrow buttons even within a single PDF file.

entries.source: Don't open a single PDF file in multiple tabs
entries.translated: Don't open a single PDF file in multiple tabs

entries.source: Don't move focus to PDF viewer after opening a PDF link
entries.translated: Don't move focus to PDF viewer after opening a PDF link

entries.source: This option will be ignored when you open a PDF link in a tab in the same split as the PDF viewer.
entries.translated: This option will be ignored when you open a PDF link in a tab in the same split as the PDF viewer.

entries.source: When opening a link to an already opened PDF file, highlight the tab
entries.translated: When opening a link to an already opened PDF file, highlight the tab

entries.source: Preserve the current zoom level when opening a link to an already opened PDF file
entries.translated: Preserve the current zoom level when opening a link to an already opened PDF file

entries.source: When you open a link to a PDF file that's already opened, Obsidian's default behavior causes the zoom level to be reset to fit the width of the PDF file to the viewer. If enabled, the current zoom level will be preserved. This option will be ignored in PDF embeds.
entries.translated: When you open a link to a PDF file that's already opened, Obsidian's default behavior causes the zoom level to be reset to fit the width of the PDF file to the viewer. If enabled, the current zoom level will be preserved. This option will be ignored in PDF embeds.

entries.source: Preserve the current horizontal scroll position
entries.translated: Preserve the current horizontal scroll position

entries.source: How to open PDF links when there is no open PDF file
entries.translated: How to open PDF links when there is no open PDF file

entries.source: Open PDF links next to an existing PDF tab
entries.translated: Open PDF links next to an existing PDF tab

entries.source: Open PDF link instead of showing popover preview when target PDF is already opened
entries.translated: Open PDF link instead of showing popover preview when target PDF is already opened

entries.source: Press ctrl while hovering a PDF link to actually open it if the target PDF is already opened in another tab.
entries.translated: Press ctrl while hovering a PDF link to actually open it if the target PDF is already opened in another tab.

entries.source: Open PDF links with an external app
entries.translated: Open PDF links with an external app

entries.source: Clear highlights after a certain amount of time
entries.translated: Clear highlights after a certain amount of time

entries.source: Highlight duration (sec)
entries.translated: Highlight duration (sec)

entries.source: Ignore "height" parameter in popover preview
entries.translated: Ignore "height" parameter in popover preview

entries.source: Obsidian lets you specify the height of a PDF embed by appending "&height=..." to a link, and this also applies to popover previews. Enable this option if you want to ignore the height parameter in popover previews.
entries.translated: Obsidian lets you specify the height of a PDF embed by appending "&height=..." to a link, and this also applies to popover previews. Enable this option if you want to ignore the height parameter in popover previews.

entries.source: Double click PDF embeds to open links
entries.translated: Double click PDF embeds to open links

entries.source: Double-clicking a PDF embed will open the embedded file.
entries.translated: Double-clicking a PDF embed will open the embedded file.

entries.source: Trim selection/annotation embeds
entries.translated: Trim selection/annotation embeds

entries.source: Hide sidebar in PDF embeds or PDF popover previews by default
entries.translated: Hide sidebar in PDF embeds or PDF popover previews by default

entries.source: Don't display PDF embeds or PDF popover previews in "two page" layout
entries.translated: Don't display PDF embeds or PDF popover previews in "two page" layout

entries.source: Regardless of the "two page" layout setting in existing PDF viewer, PDF embeds and PDF popover previews will be always displayed in "single page" layout. You can still turn it on for each embed by clicking the "two page" button in the toolbar, if shown.
entries.translated: Regardless of the "two page" layout setting in existing PDF viewer, PDF embeds and PDF popover previews will be always displayed in "single page" layout. You can still turn it on for each embed by clicking the "two page" button in the toolbar, if shown.

entries.source: Don't highlight text in text selection embeds
entries.translated: Don't highlight text in text selection embeds

entries.source: Don't highlight annotations in annotation embeds
entries.translated: Don't highlight annotations in annotation embeds

entries.source: Don't clear highlights in text selection embeds
entries.translated: Don't clear highlights in text selection embeds

entries.source: Don't clear highlights in annotation embeds
entries.translated: Don't clear highlights in annotation embeds

entries.source: Make PDF embeds with a page specified unscrollable
entries.translated: Make PDF embeds with a page specified unscrollable

entries.source: After changing this option, you need to reopen tabs or reload the app.
entries.translated: After changing this option, you need to reopen tabs or reload the app.

entries.source: Filter backlinks by page by default
entries.translated: Filter backlinks by page by default

entries.source: You can toggle this on and off with the "Show only backlinks in the current page" button at the top right of the backlinks pane.
entries.translated: You can toggle this on and off with the "Show only backlinks in the current page" button at the top right of the backlinks pane.

entries.source: Show backlinks to the entire page
entries.translated: Show backlinks to the entire page

entries.translated: If turned off, only backlinks to specific text selections, annotations or locations will be shown when filtering the backlinks page by page.

entries.source: Hover sync (PDF viewer → Backlinks pane)
entries.translated: Hover sync (PDF viewer → Backlinks pane)

entries.translated: Hovering your mouse over highlighted text or annotation will also highlight the corresponding item in the backlink pane.

entries.source: Hover sync (Backlinks pane → PDF viewer)
entries.translated: Hover sync (Backlinks pane → PDF viewer)

entries.translated: In the backlinks pane, hover your mouse over an backlink item to highlight the corresponding text or annotation in the PDF viewer. This option requires reopening or switching tabs to take effect.

entries.translated: Highlight color for hover sync (Backlinks pane → PDF viewer)

entries.translated: To add a new color, click the "+" button in the "highlight colors" setting above.

entries.translated: Open PDF links with the OS-defined default application for PDF files.

entries.translated: Sync the external app with Obsidian

entries.translated: When you focus on a PDF file in Obsidian, the external app will also focus on the same file.

entries.translated: Focus Obsidian after opening a PDF file with an external app

entries.translated: Default location for new dummy PDF files

entries.source: Where newly created dummy PDF files are placed. If set to "Same as Obsidian's attachment location", dummy files will be saved in the folder specified in Obsidian settings > Files and links > Default location for new attachments.
entries.translated: Where newly created dummy PDF files are placed. If set to "Same as Obsidian's attachment location", dummy files will be saved in the folder specified in Obsidian settings > Files and links > Default location for new attachments.

entries.translated: Vault folder

entries.source: Place newly created dummy PDF files in this folder.
entries.translated: Place newly created dummy PDF files in this folder.

entries.source: Subfolder name
entries.translated: Subfolder name

entries.source: If your file is under "vault/folder", and you set subfolder name to "attachments", dummy PDF files will be saved to "vault/folder/attachments".
entries.translated: If your file is under "vault/folder", and you set subfolder name to "attachments", dummy PDF files will be saved to "vault/folder/attachments".

entries.source: Modifier key to create a dummy PDF file on drag & drop
entries.translated: Modifier key to create a dummy PDF file on drag & drop

entries.source: After dragging an external PDF file, drop it on the editor while pressing this modifier key to create a dummy file and insert a link to it. You can drag a URL to a PDF file on the web from within your browser (link, URL bar, bookmark, etc.) or a PDF file on your desktop machine from your file manager (File Explorer etc.). Note that on mobile, you might need to start pressing the modifier key before starting the drag operation.
entries.translated: After dragging an external PDF file, drop it on the editor while pressing this modifier key to create a dummy file and insert a link to it. You can drag a URL to a PDF file on the web from within your browser (link, URL bar, bookmark, etc.) or a PDF file on your desktop machine from your file manager (File Explorer etc.). Note that on mobile, you might need to start pressing the modifier key before starting the drag operation.

entries.translated: Shift

entries.translated: Ctrl

entries.translated: Ctrl+Shift

entries.source: URI patterns for PDF files
entries.translated: URI patterns for PDF files

entries.source: Specify the URI pattens for PDFs in regular expressions. When dragging and dropping a URI/URL from your browser to Obsidian's editor, it will be used to check if the destination file is a PDF file. If you need multiple patterns, separate them with a new line.
entries.translated: Specify the URI pattens for PDFs in regular expressions. When dragging and dropping a URI/URL from your browser to Obsidian's editor, it will be used to check if the destination file is a PDF file. If you need multiple patterns, separate them with a new line.

entries.source: The default keybindings are as follows. You can customize them be creating a "vimrc" file and providing its path in the setting below.
entries.translated: The default keybindings are as follows. You can customize them be creating a "vimrc" file and providing its path in the setting below.

entries.translated: Many of the commands above can be combined with counts. For example:

entries.translated: Reopen the PDF viewers after changing this option.

entries.translated: Vimrc file path (optional)

entries.source: Example (not necessarily recommendations):
entries.translated: Example (not necessarily recommendations):

entries.source: After changing the path or the file content, you need to reopen the PDF viewer. If the vimrc file is a hidden file or is under a hidden folder, you need to reload PDF++ or the app.
entries.translated: After changing the path or the file content, you need to reopen the PDF viewer. If the vimrc file is a hidden file or is under a hidden folder, you need to reload PDF++ or the app.

entries.translated: Enter outline mode when opening PDF outline view

entries.translated: Smooth motion in outline mode

entries.translated: Use arrow down/up keys to go back and forth the command history.

entries.translated: Hint mode (experimental)

entries.source: Also check out Style Settings > PDF++ > Vim keybindings > Hint mode.
entries.translated: Also check out Style Settings > PDF++ > Vim keybindings > Hint mode.

entries.source: Characters to use in hint mode
entries.translated: Characters to use in hint mode

entries.source: They are used preferentially from left to right, so you might want to put the easier-to-reach keys first. This is the same as Tridactyl's "hintchars" option.
entries.translated: They are used preferentially from left to right, so you might want to put the easier-to-reach keys first. This is the same as Tridactyl's "hintchars" option.

entries.source: Default arguments for the ":hint" Ex command
entries.translated: Default arguments for the ":hint" Ex command

entries.source: Space-separated list of "link"/"annot"/"backlink" or "all". Run ":help :hint" for the details.
entries.translated: Space-separated list of "link"/"annot"/"backlink" or "all". Run ":help :hint" for the details.

entries.source: Context menu
entries.translated: Context menu

entries.source: Enable Vim keys in PDF context menus
entries.translated: Enable Vim keys in PDF context menus

entries.source: If enabled, you can use j/k/h/l keys, instead of the arrow keys, to navigate through context menu items in the PDF viewer.
entries.translated: If enabled, you can use j/k/h/l keys, instead of the arrow keys, to navigate through context menu items in the PDF viewer.

entries.source: Scrolling
entries.translated: Scrolling

entries.source: Scroll size (px) of the jkhl keys
entries.translated: Scroll size (px) of the jkhl keys

entries.source: The size of scroll when one of the jkhl keys is pressed once.
entries.translated: The size of scroll when one of the jkhl keys is pressed once.

entries.translated: Increase scroll size when zoomed in

entries.translated: Speed of continuous scroll (px per ms)

entries.translated: The speed of scroll when pressing and holding down the jkhl keys.

entries.source: Smooth scroll
entries.translated: Smooth scroll

entries.source: Search
entries.translated: Search

entries.source: hlsearch
entries.translated: hlsearch

entries.source: If enabled, all matches will be highlighted.
entries.translated: If enabled, all matches will be highlighted.

entries.source: incsearch
entries.translated: incsearch

entries.source: Incremental search: while typing the search query, update the search results after every keystroke. If disabled, the results will be shown only after pressing Enter.
entries.translated: Incremental search: while typing the search query, update the search results after every keystroke. If disabled, the results will be shown only after pressing Enter.

entries.source: Automatically check for updates
entries.translated: Automatically check for updates

entries.source: If enabled, PDF++ will automatically check for updates every 24 hours and notify you if a new version is available.
entries.translated: If enabled, PDF++ will automatically check for updates every 24 hours and notify you if a new version is available.

entries.source: Fix Obsidian 1.9's text selection bug
entries.translated: Fix Obsidian 1.9's text selection bug

entries.source: Show status in PDF toolbar
entries.translated: Show status in PDF toolbar

entries.source: For example, when you copy a link to a text selection in a PDF file, the status "Link copied" will be displayed in the PDF toolbar.
entries.translated: For example, when you copy a link to a text selection in a PDF file, the status "Link copied" will be displayed in the PDF toolbar.

entries.source: Default location for new PDFs
entries.translated: Default location for new PDFs

entries.source: The "Create new PDF" command will create a new PDF file in the location specified here.
entries.translated: The "Create new PDF" command will create a new PDF file in the location specified here.

entries.source: Folder to create new PDFs in
entries.translated: Folder to create new PDFs in

entries.source: Newly created PDFs will appear under this folder.
entries.translated: Newly created PDFs will appear under this folder.

entries.source: Hide reply annotations
entries.translated: Hide reply annotations

entries.source: Hide annotations that are replies to other annotations in the PDF viewer.
entries.translated: Hide annotations that are replies to other annotations in the PDF viewer.

entries.source: This is a temporary fix for the issue that PDF.js (the library Obsidian's PDF viewer is based on) does not fulfill the PDF specification in that it renders reply annotations as if a standalone annotation.
entries.translated: This is a temporary fix for the issue that PDF.js (the library Obsidian's PDF viewer is based on) does not fulfill the PDF specification in that it renders reply annotations as if a standalone annotation.

entries.source: Disable popups for rubber stamp annotations
entries.translated: Disable popups for rubber stamp annotations

entries.source: A rubber stamp annotation is a type of annotation that displays text or graphics intended to look like a rubber stamp. However, some applications, including iOS/iPadOS's "Markup", use this type of annotation also for handwriting. Often, all pieces of handwriting in a single page are grouped into a single rubber stamp annotation, which tends to be so large that it covers the entire page. In this case, annotation popups can be annoying, so you can disable them here.
entries.translated: A rubber stamp annotation is a type of annotation that displays text or graphics intended to look like a rubber stamp. However, some applications, including iOS/iPadOS's "Markup", use this type of annotation also for handwriting. Often, all pieces of handwriting in a single page are grouped into a single rubber stamp annotation, which tends to be so large that it covers the entire page. In this case, annotation popups can be annoying, so you can disable them here.

entries.source: Remove half-width whitespace between two Chinese/Japanese characters when copying text
entries.translated: Remove half-width whitespace between two Chinese/Japanese characters when copying text

entries.source: Such whitespace can be introduced as a result of poor post-processing of OCR (optical character recognition). Enable this option to remove it when copying links to text selections.
entries.translated: Such whitespace can be introduced as a result of poor post-processing of OCR (optical character recognition). Enable this option to remove it when copying links to text selections.

entries.source: Override the default copy behavior in the PDF viewer
entries.translated: Override the default copy behavior in the PDF viewer

entries.source: "PATH" environment variable
entries.translated: "PATH" environment variable

entries.source: Provide the "PATH" environment variable for PDF++ to run shell commands without the full paths specified. In MacOS and Linux, you can run "echo $PATH" in Terminal and then copy & paste the result here. Currently, it will be used only when you run ":!<command>" in Vim mode.
entries.translated: Provide the "PATH" environment variable for PDF++ to run shell commands without the full paths specified. In MacOS and Linux, you can run "echo $PATH" in Terminal and then copy & paste the result here. Currently, it will be used only when you run ":!<command>" in Vim mode.

entries.source: You can find more options in Style Settings > PDF++.
entries.translated: You can find more options in Style Settings > PDF++.

entries.translated: Open style settings

entries.translated: If you find PDF++ helpful, please consider supporting the development to help me keep this plugin alive. If you prefer PayPal, please make donations via Ko-fi. Thank you!
